meanings.definition: Make a harsh, high-pitched sound or cry.
meanings.sent1: The old door was screaking as it opened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The rusty swing set was screaking loudly in the playground.
meanings.sent3: The mouse was screaking in protest as the cat chased it around the room.
meanings.sent4: The brakes of the car were screaking like a banshee in the night.
meanings.sent5: The hinges of the gate were screaking with every movement, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A harsh, high-pitched sound or cry.
meanings.sent1: The screaking of the seagulls filled the air by the beach.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was filled with the eerie screaking of unknown origin.
meanings.sent3: The screaking of the violin in the orchestra added a comical touch to the performance.
meanings.sent4: The screaking of the rusty swing set was a symphony of childhood memories.
meanings.sent5: The screaking of the old floorboards echoed through the empty house, sending shivers down the spine.
